comment.author: 80278590@N00
comment._content: Looks like they're cleaning and bagging onions.

comment.author: 41378066@N00
comment._content: I thought onions too, but the foliage in the background suggests some sort of potato.

comment.author: 80278590@N00
comment._content: Looking at the full-sized TIFF ( memory.loc.gov/master/pnp/fsac/1a34000/1a34400/1a34435u.tif ) I think you're right.

comment.author: 10213344@N07
comment._content: I think its onions for sure and they are taking off the outer husks/skins with that machine.  Doing it right out there in the field, that must have been way before a factory.

comment.author: 23393335@N06
comment._content: The bag clinches it for me: onions are more often in mesh bag such as seems to be the case here

comment.author: 79313659@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called people working, and we'd love to have your photo added to the group.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks to everyone for the observations. A series of photographs by Arthur Rothstein in our black-and-white Farm Security Administration collection appears to have been taken at the same time as this image. The original captions to those images indicate onions are being harvested. Here is an example of a very similar shot: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/fsa.8b18380. Changes here will not appear immediately, as we need to keep the information we show in Flickr and in our own catalog ( www.loc.gov/rr/print/catalog.html ) in sync.
